verbose_text: Mutations in both the hemagglutinin (HA) and neuraminidase (NA) genes have allowed influenza B virus to circumvent the immune response in humans, to persist in human populations, to circulate in an endemic environment, and to cause recurrent seasonal epidemics [XREF_BIBR - XREF_BIBR].
evidence: hemagglutinin (HA) and neuraminidase (NA) genes have allowed influenza B virus to circumvent the immune response
